vague_description: Determine the optimal production quantities for two beverage products under specific resource constraints to achieve maximum profitability.
detailed_description: A milk tea shop owner would like to sell two different milk teas: black milk tea and matcha milk tea. Each contains both milk and honey. A bottle of black milk tea contains \param{BlackMilk} grams of milk and \param{BlackHoney} grams of honey, whereas a bottle of matcha milk tea contains \param{MatchaMilk} grams of milk and \param{MatchaHoney} grams of honey. The profit from each bottle of black milk tea sold is \param{ProfitBlack} and the profit from each bottle of matcha milk tea sold is \param{ProfitMatcha}. If his total production must not exceed his available stock of \param{TotalMilk} grams of milk and \param{TotalHoney} grams of honey, how many bottles of each type of milk tea should be made to maximize profits?
target_objective: Maximize the total profit from selling black and matcha milk tea bottles
target_constraints: Number of black milk tea bottles is non-negative
Number of matcha milk tea bottles is non-negative
Total milk used for black and matcha milk teas does not exceed TotalMilk grams
Total honey used for black and matcha milk teas does not exceed TotalHoney grams
target_parameters: Amount of milk in a bottle of black milk tea
Amount of honey in a bottle of black milk tea
Amount of milk in a bottle of matcha milk tea
Amount of honey in a bottle of matcha milk tea
Profit from selling one bottle of black milk tea
Profit from selling one bottle of matcha milk tea
